description: GET request that core node information
title: CoreNodeInfoResponse

peer_version.description: identifies the version number for the networking communication, this should not change while a node is running, and will only change if there's an upgrade

pox_consensus.description: is a hash used to identify the burnchain view for a node. it incorporates bitcoin chain information and PoX information. nodes that disagree on this value will appear to each other as forks. this value will change after every block

stable_pox_consensus.description: same as burn_consensus, but evaluated at stable_burn_block_height

stable_burn_block_height.description: leftover from stacks 1.0, basically always burn_block_height - 1

network_id.description: is similar to peer_version and will be used to differentiate between different testnets. this value will be different between mainnet and testnet. once launched, this value will not change

parent_network_id.description: same as network_id, but for bitcoin

stacks_tip_height.description: the latest Stacks chain height. Stacks forks can occur independent of the Bitcoin chain, that height doesn't increase 1-to-1 with the Bitcoin height

stacks_tip.description: the best known block hash for the Stack chain (not including any pending microblocks)

stacks_tip_consensus_hash.description: the burn chain (i.e., bitcoin) consensus hash at the time that stacks_tip was mined

unanchored_tip.description: the latest microblock hash if any microblocks were processed. if no microblock has been processed for the current block, a 000.., hex array is returned

exit_at_block_height.description: the block height at which the testnet network will be reset. not applicable for mainnet
